Finally, it is in the game, because MCPE-174673 is resolved as Works As Intended.

There should be a new rope item crafted from string and used to craft various things like leads and rope ladders.     Rope ladders should be able to be raised and lowered by redstone and crafted from rope and sticks. I agree it should be crafted in bundles, maybe 8 blocks?, but you can add bundles to make the ladder longer
Maybe rope bridges too?
you should also be able to get the entire rope ladder that was used by right clicking the top or bottom, making traversing vertically much easier
I agree, it is also worth adding the ability to freely build the ladder up and down if one of the parts is fixed on a solid block.
This seems interesting. Glass-logging isn't exactly the best name though. Maybe it should be called "Window"

Great idea! I've wanted this for while as well. However, I think there would be a programming problem with the addition as you have described it. Currently, there are no blocks that can occupy the same space as another block. I think there is some technical reason behind this. Instead, Another option is to have a separate recipe for stair blocks that have glass built into them. The only problem with my idea is that it would open a whole can of worms where EVERY stair and slab variant would need a separate block ID for the glass-filled variant.
YAS
Desprately wanted by anyone who has ever tried to build an arched window.

I was about to make a suggestion of having panes connect to slabs and stairs always, but your idea is better!

This way the player can decide whether they want the panes to connect or not, or even have just one pane in the slab/stair. Much more customizability & player control.

THIS! This is what I have so desperately needed every time I have made a larger build! I ALWAYS do arched windows, but then I canâ€™t make the glass connect and it looks really bad. Especially with stained glass. This would make it look so much nicer!

I love roasted pumpkin seeds.  I make them all the time.  With the number of seeds that pop off of pumpkins, it would be a neat item to obtain.

In addition, it could be the start of a new recipe as well.  I'm thinking a Granola Bar.  Made with sugar, pumpkin seeds, and wheat.
How many food points will it give you?
Yeah, that would be very nice! I'm guessing they would have to only provide half a hunger point each, like potatoes, since they are readily available.
I'd say that roasted pumpkin seeds are a much needed addition, especially if you have pumpkins and no real food at the start of a world
adding roasted pumpkin seeds would be so amazing! I feel they should have the same saturation and food points as dried kelp since you can get so much ^u^

Staff with both melee and range would be interesting, though could cause problems for effect consistency.
Maybe the staff should have items as ammo instead of enchantments.
Fire Charges for fireball effect, Snowball for cold effect plus slowness, Emeralds for gound spikes, Ender Pearl's to teleport, and Spider Eyes to poison.

I love this idea ðŸ’¥ðŸ¤¯

Very Good idea, this is what we need to improve combat. I would suggest this.

There should be a base staff, the Standard Magic Staff, this one would be crafted using Gold (one of the most magical materials in the game), Wooden Sticks and some kind of Pearl or Cristal (chance for new ore here). I imagine this item would look like this (sprite made by me):

By pressing the use item button (right click) this would shot a white luminous orb at a speed of 30 blocks per second and would travel up to 60 or 90 blocks away. It would have a base damage of 1 if you shot it instantly, but if you charge it for at least 0.5 seconds, the damag would increase to 3; if you charge it for at least 1.0 second, the damage would increase to 5; and if you charge it for at least 1.5 seconds, the damage would increase to 7 that's the maximum you would be able to get.

Then, just like you said, enchantments or special recipes would create new kinds of Staffs that would have special shots with special properties.

I feel like this staff should be crafted using an alter which needs 5 chiseled stone and any enchanted, Three stones on the bottom 2 on the sides and the enchanted book in the center. The alter can be used like a crafting table but it can also be used to craft magical objects. And here's my suggestion for the staff.

You get the staff but then you'll get the mount and the jewel each part will improve the staff's durability, storage, resistance to breaking, and power. The player would be able to customize the staff from training with a wizard or dark wizard. Each wizard teaches a different type of magic wizards teaching good magic and dark wizards teaching dark magic. 

The staff should also need the souls of certain mobs to cast spell. For example a teleportation spell: endermen. Souls however can be used up so you'll need to capture more. You'll also be able to open a menu to select which soul you'd like to use and how much durability it has left. 

Staffs will be able to be broken but I don't know how the reason I'd like to have this is so the souls that weren't used that were in the staff can take their revenge on you.

That's a great idea, but if you right click or hold the screen with your staff in hand, it should have one inventory slot that allows u to put different items for different types of powers.

The staffs combined with different items should have different powers. Give your staff a clock and you can freeze time for 5 seconds (5 xp per use). Give it a blaze rod and you can shoot flame particles that burn mobs (15 xp per use; 5 seconds per use). Give it an elytra and can grant you flight for 10 seconds (20 xp per use). Give it a ghast tear, and it will give regeneration 4 for 20 seconds (30 xp per use). Give a nether star, you can shoot 10 wither skulls (5 xp per wither skull). Finally, give it a dragon egg to summon a baby ender dragon in battle (only lasts for 5 minutes, uses 50 xp per use. Stats: 150 hearts, shoots ender breath, and does 10 attack damage. Can also ride and control it.

Staff have a durability of 600, can be enchanted with unbreaking and a new enchantment restoration which allows you to use spells for less xp (only 1 level).

PS I got your idea before I saw your form. XD. Great minds think a like?
Way too op.  Putting them in a nether fortress doesnâ€™t help.

I think that this could work. To nerf them enough, make them an item that doesnâ€™t just require 3 precious blocks, but 5. In addition to that, make the mining speed slower than the pickaxe one notch down. (Eg dia hammer mines slightly slower than iron pickaxe.) in addition, hammers could mine at the mining level of the tool below them (e.g. dia hammer canâ€™t mine obsidian or netherite.) While adding hammers may seem way too OP, I think that making them expensive and making them a poor mining tool would sufficiently nerf them into a space-clearer.

The icon or texture for the hammer could be the same one they have on anvils.

Maybe one way to make them less overpowered could be to make the crafting recipe not five, but six of the selected material in a sign or banner position. Obviously, they would also mine slower and have a cool down timer on them.
They could also mine glass faster.

Hammers have been present in the game since the beginning (crafting table texture) and nowadays is being presented again in 2 new textures (smithing table outside texture and GUI texture) that's the reason I have to says that is logical to have the hammers as a permanent tool/weapon.

-Tool usage 1: Right clicking stones to make "cracked" variants of stones, smelting stones doesnÂ´t make much sense

-Tool usage 2: Hammers should be the prefered tool to break glass faster. Of course silk touch could be added.

-Weapon: It could be a mix of melee and mid range weapon.

-Enchantments: Normal tool enchants & Loyalty. Earthquake, aiming the hammer to the floor or entity feet shoukd shake them. ThorÂ´s shock: hitting an entity shocks them and their nearby allies.

Hammers would be great to add to the game, I know Jeb has said on his MC game design book, "1 block at time" (like you shouldn't be able to mine multiple blocks at once), but I have a workaround for that. First it should be 2x2, and you shouldn't get the blocks mined. It would also mine very quickly. This would be great because things like strip mining are so boring and slow, and doesn't bring any fun to the game. So this hammer idea would really help, especially if you don't need all the blocks you're mining (usually stone) and prevents an inevitable full inventory issue. Plus, it brings strategy to mining. You have a choice to either mine and get all the blocks when tunneling very slowly and inefficiently, or you use a hammer that mines efficiently, but you don't get the drops, and you can then use your pickaxe on the actual ores. It shouldn't even count against the "1 block at a time" rule because with this hammer idea, you aren't mining the blocks... you're destroying them. It's kind of like a more controlled version of a TNT tactic.

For my hammer idea, if 2x2 mining won't happen even just for destroying blocks, then I have an alternative way. Instead, each next block you break as long as its next to the previous broken block in any direction (basically in a 3x3x3 area of the previous broken block in the center), it will mine faster, of course with a speed limit at some point & you would have to keep mining in order to continue mining faster. I got this idea similar to 1 that Cam@MinecraftAbormals had for alternatives for vein mining, which was an enchantment that broke blocks faster if it was the same type of block as you previously had broken. Really cool idea. That way, it's still 1 block at a time.
Wow
Wow

Maybe mining 3x3 is kinda redundant since you can insta-mine pretty much everything with beacons and enchanted netherite (currently not deepslate - but I think they'll come up with something) and already existing in mods so I have a better idea: how about it crack stone bricks, blackstone and other cracked varients when it breaks said block? Maybe it can grind down cobble to gravel and gravel to sand, concrete back to powder and so on. May be used as a weapon too? Similar to axes but with it's own individuality (I'm sure Mojang would come up with something interesting)

We should be able to block the beacon beam (or turn the beam invisible) without impacting the function of the beacon so that you can keep the sky clear of beacon beams while still experiencing the effects of the beacon.
It would make sense for black glass to have this function rather than creating a black beam as it does currently, since â€˜black lightâ€™ doesnâ€™t really exist.
I too would like a method to turn the beam invisible. I think the use of black glass to achieve it is an excellent suggestion.
How about just removing the sky access requirement?

Not sure about the whole block being able to control this, but maybe a beacon menu option to turn off the beacon beam visibility, or even when the beacon is powered the beam turns off. So we could throw a lever on the side of it and toggle it off. No matter the outcome, I would love the ability to just turn off the beam without losing the effects.
From the new 20w45a snapshot, I suggest that Tinted Glass should be used for this.

Was about to suggest to turn off the beam but NOT the effects, and your post showed up, so yeah I'm looking for this functionality, but I was thinking to use tinted glass since that's how it works in real life.

This would be super helpful for keeping beacon affects like speed, which just add quality of life around your base while also keeping the sky pollution in your world to a minimum for clean aerial views of your world.

Sorry but any kind of furniture will not be added into Minecraft.
I would consider furniture more of a chair table desk kind of situation
plus it would make bookshelves more expensive.
Sorry Blast Burner, I disagree, this would allow a considerable amount of customization and creativity. As for making bookshelves more expensive, perhaps three books fill it up completely.
I would agree with you Some Animal but Mojang just doesn't want any furniture in game otherwise I would be in.

Mojang doesnâ€™t want any furniture because it limits creativity.
But all the shelves would do is amplify it because of the ability to actually display multiple items in the block.

@Blast Burner

A bed is a piece of furniture, so is a lantern, lectern, bookshelf and so on. Chairs were also planned at some point before Jeb took over and frowned upon furniture, despite the game already having it. For a game that expects creativity, they sure limit objects to put inside of houses. I'd like to have shelves to display items in a more meaningful way rather than using a item frame.

We should have shelfâ€™s where items can be placed similarly to chests but the items show up on the shelfâ€™s in a 3D way. You could also add books of course. They could be stacked one on top of the other, put on walls or on the floor, and they would come in all of the wood types and maybe even stones.

I like this idea since libraries in minecraft are not really like a "library".There are so many bookshelves but you can't read the books in them. A really good concept where this has been made is the Uncensored Library, a minecraft server made to publish works of journalists prosecuted in their countries. Though the build in the server is really nice and spacious, it could really use more space for readable books... and a lot of lecterns to hold books don't really look as fancy than they are on the shelves.

As to the people arguing about that mojang doesn't like furniture... Think about shelves as like a storage item like chests and enderchests... I mean they are still furniture. Its really just to add a practical use for bookshelves other than just enchanting and mere aesthetics.

A really good tangent on this would be dyeble books (since they're also made of leather)... that way one could create a rainbow collection of books... or classify books according to colors...

Very nice!

I had some similar ideas, but slightly differently executed.

Basically, I would like to make Scaffolding "remember", on which side it was attached to another scaffolding or to a normal block upon placing - for example, if Scaffolding is placed against a wall - it will know that. So, Scaffolding has a chain/tree-like stucture - chain is for chaining, and tree because branches. And when, for example, the scaffolding, that has "down" source direction, has the block below it removed, it breaks and causes any scaffolding attached to it to also break - and so on, until the entire "branch" collapses.

This removes the need in the "distance" blockstate, replacing it with "origin" one which has only 6 values ("up" is also a thing - see original suggestion, the part where it talks about the ability to extend Scaffolding downwards), and in the Scaffolding being affected by gravity, while making it actually useful in building - current implementation makes dirt simply more viable.

I'm glad you like it! I still prefer my execution however, because it would be hard to track all the different chains if they overlapped, but I guess it could be useful in some instances. My idea would only require one boolean value: isBase.
This sounds very good!!
In addition it this I think most transparent blocks could be included. It could look great hanging lanterns off of leaves, etc..

It would be like decoration on a villager. If your asking why these should be in the game, ask yourselves why paintings, bookshelves, and other things are in the game. You could make a machinima better by putting one in your hand as you fall asleep. You could act childish and put one in your offhand. Idea: you can use these as weapons. Toss them at creepers. That would be fun! Besides, Minecraft needs more weapons.

No. If you're asking why bookshelves are in the game, it is to make libraries and to boost enchantment levels. Paintings, we can make hidden entrances! And by other stuff, I will use flower pots. They don't have a beneficial use, but it fits the game WAY BETTER than toys held by baby villagers.

Oh, and how exactly will you obtain this item? I'm assuming either taking it from it's hands (which is cruel) or killing the baby (which is even cruel-er [if that's a word]) I also found it very offensive to ClayGoddess and Macchu when you said "multiple possibilities that you clearly can't visualize" I found it as you said that they don't have imagination. And to obtain the item, if it was used as a weapon, you would have to kill the baby. And to get another one, if you killed the baby with the toy, I think that would be super cruel. Adding this would just add a whole new level of cruelty to the game.

Many Minecraft players would find this item useless. I understand this would be useful for role play and machinima, but the're are mods out there that include toys, for example DecoCraft.

RiptideDolphin, you way over analyzed this, and you are probably finding as many ways as possible to criticize my idea. A wee bit of advice, think of this as something added to the game, not some random idea that you supposedly love to contemplate about negatively (I can't imagine how long you were trying to put this idea down).

I think that this should be carried in stacks, but a knife would be able to use the Loyalty enchantment or something new like Boomerang 1. It would do less damage than a trident but could be enchaned with sharpness/power.

A few suggestions:

Add tiers (wood, diamond, gold)

You don't need to charge your throw like a trident, it throws instantly when you right click

When held in your offhand, it'll throw if the item you're wielding has no right-click action

It can deal melee damage

knives can be stacked in your inventory maybe with a max of 8 per stack. similar to a trident the knife will be retrievable weather you hit a mob or not. this would keep the cost down and im trying to think of a good beginning game projectile weapon.

similar to a bow it would deal a certain % of max damage depending on the "charge".

Max damage would be as fallows (Wood = 4, Gold = 4, Stone = 5, Iron = 6, Diamond = 7, Netherite = 8) same as sward damage.

the throwing knives could have all the same enchantments added as the bow and crossbow

It is a clever idea, but my issue with this is that it makes milk almost completely useless. The only exceptions would be the Wither effect from Wither Skeletons and the Wither, and Witches sometimes giving you slowness.

Milk would still be useful for things like withered, slowness or blindness and its not like tropical fish are common so milk would still be good to use sometimes. Another idea is that mojang could add more food items that require milk to craft, like how cakes use milk in their crafting recipe.

Milk could even be used by milking a cow, waiting a few days so it can go off and then using the sour milk for things like making crops grow faster (It would be like bonemeal only weaker and easier to get).

There are many other uses for milk that could be added.
What about Clownfish Sushi, Clownfish Soup or Stew, and I think these two ideas are a possibilities for Clownfish use.

maybe since it's a CLOWNfish you could do something like a potion of disguise which makes hostile mobs ignore you as long as you don't attack them. If you attack a hostile mob while this potions effect is active all mobs that should ignore you in a 15 block radius or so get hostile again. Illagers shouldn't be affected by the potion because they are intelligent, creepers should also not be affected by the potion they should just stop chasing you while this potion is active but they sould still be able to explode if you get too close to them. Also endermen shouldn't be affected because you still have to look them in the eyes to make the hostile.
There could be more tiers of the potion. for example the first one which lets lesser mobs ignore you (All the Overworld stuff) and the second tier that would affect the mobs in the nether. I'm not quite sure how the recipe for the tier II potion should be but it should be an item that is a bit harder to get.
